page.title: 17HOUSING
page.content: The majority of dwellings in this area were constructed between 1920-1970. Since then, little building work has been undertaken, since the land is desgnated green belt, a small propor- tion is an area of outstanding beauty. Most of the farms are much older than 1920.A small council estate was built in Ashley Green, & the local author- ity own a large caravan site in Whel- lpley Hill. In recent years, many council houses have been bought by their tennants. A typical private home in this area, would stand in its own garden, & would have 3/4 bedrooms, kitchen, two reception rooms. The ma- jority are gas or oil central heating, on main sewerage, and many are double glazed. Architectural styles are vari- ed, and mostly constructed of brick, some are made of local flint.
